Pay close attention to the dynamics of motorcycles; if they suddenly change lanes or stop, be prepared to react. Watch for pedestrians standing by the roadside; do not speed, and be ready to stop if a pedestrian steps onto the road. Considering road conditions and potential congestion caused by large vehicles ahead, reduce speed, stay alert, and be prepared for any maneuvers by pedestrians or motorcyclists. Due to obstacles on the left, avoid unnecessary lane changes and adjust your driving behavior according to potentially slippery road conditions, such as slowing down and extending braking distance. Since farm vehicles are large and may cause obstructions, monitor the behavior of motorcyclists who may also attempt to overtake.
